definition: to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for

sentences.english: Mr. Jacob Li will take over Mr. Mong-Heng Wong's position as a guidance counselor.
sentences.chinese: 李孟斌先生將接替王孟宏先生成爲北威的訓導主任。

sentences.english: Probably Mr. Smith will succeed to the mayoralty.
sentences.chinese: 可能中密斯先生將接替市長的職位。

sentences.english: Let me seek someone to supply when you having a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 你休假期間，我設法找個人來接替一下你的工作吧。

sentences.english: But Nurse was dead and Yezzan too sick to name a successor.
sentences.chinese: 但是但是保姆死了而耶贊病到沒法指定一個接替者。

sentences.english: My replacement has already arrived from our head office.
sentences.chinese: 我的接替者已經從我們的總公司來了。

sentences.english: By the time Ben was fagged out, Tom had traded the next chance to Billy Fisher for a kite, in good repair;
sentences.chinese: 比利用一個修得很好的風箏換來接替本的機會。

sentences.english: We needed to find a replacement for Alonso, and Aquilani is a top class player.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要阿隆索的接替者，阿奎拉尼是個頂級球員。

sentences.english: Any one could supersede you as manager in my office.
sentences.chinese: 我辦公室中的任何一個人都可以接替你的經理職務。

sentences.english: He is taking over Axelrod's job as chief political adviser to the president.
sentences.chinese: 他將接替阿克塞爾羅德，成爲總統首席政治顧問。

sentences.english: 54-year-old Zhou took Yongzhi Wang's place as chief designer 5 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 5年前接替王永志出任總設計師的周建平娓娓道來。

sentences.english: Late in the evening cadets on duty wash the dishes and pass their duties to other cadets.
sentences.chinese: 晚上值班學員洗完碗後，其他學員再來接替他們。

sentences.english: Her 17-year-old sister, who also wants to be a hostess, may succeed her.
sentences.chinese: 她17歲的妹妹也想成爲陪酒女，或許可能接替她。

sentences.english: It was envisioned as a possible replacement for the STEN submachinegun then in service.
sentences.chinese: 這是設想作爲司登衝鋒槍可能接替然後在服務。

sentences.english: He soon succeeded joffre as commander-in-chief .
sentences.chinese: 他不久就接替霞飛擔任總司令職務。

sentences.english: He was pensioned off and replaced with a young girl.
sentences.chinese: 他被迫退休，由一位年輕姑娘接替其職務。

sentences.english: Since the merchant's son succeeded him in business, affairs go wrong.
sentences.chinese: 自從那商人的兒子接替其父業後，事情便搞得一團糟。

definition: to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to succeed sb in a job/successor
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to withdraw to the second line of duty/to resign from a leading post (and assume an advisory post)
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
